troubleshooting.title: Identifying a Missing Cylinder
troubleshooting.shortdesc: Locate a misfiring cylinder by systematically testing cylinder pairs through manipulation of spark coil vibrators.

condition.p: When one cylinder is misfiring and needs to be identified.

step.cmd: Open the throttle until the engine reaches a good operating speed.
Hold down vibrators for cylinders No. 1 and No. 4 (the outside vibrators).
step.info: This prevents these vibrators from buzzing and cuts out their corresponding cylinders.
step.stepresult: Only cylinders No. 2 and No. 3 will be running.

step.info: If cylinders No. 2 and No. 3 explode regularly, the problem is in either cylinder No. 1 or No. 4.

step.cmd: To test cylinder No. 4, release its vibrator while holding down vibrators for cylinders No. 1, No. 2, and No. 3.
step.stepresult: If cylinder No. 4 explodes evenly, the misfiring is occurring in cylinder No. 1.

step.cmd: Repeat this process for remaining cylinders as needed until the problematic cylinder is identified.
Once the problematic cylinder is identified, examine both:

ul.li: The spark plug in the affected cylinder
The vibrator corresponding to that cylinder
